result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina M. Belden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

5 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations. `

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

timeConds.notes:
** Per Order signed 10/31/22: Defendant ordered to serve 19 days of jail time as a condition of probation. **

All stayed pending further order of the court
Huber granted

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tina M. Belden

records.addlTxt: and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Proposed Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Dated 10/27/2022 from Department of Corrections Probation/Parole Agent, Darlene Pittman to Court regarding request for conditional jail time.

9:06am All parties appear via Zoom. Defendant Tina M. Belden appeared by video with Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared for Tina M. Belden.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for an arraignment. Defendant waives right to appear personally in front of the Judge, freely and voluntarily 

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. The parties have an agreement. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Possession Of Methamphetamine as a Repeater. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accept plea and finds the defendant guilty. Prior as related to this count, are acknowledged. 

Court orders:
2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions.
Conditions of Probation:
60 days jail all stayed pending further order of the court. Huber granted.
AODA and follow through with recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 
Jail credit in the event of revocation: 5 days

9:35 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina M. Belden in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tina M. Belden. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case is referred to Judge Barna for scheduling an ARGN.

9:37 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tina M. Belden not in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tina M. Belden. Attorney has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance, but states he has had good contact.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
